docs.snippet: It doesn't make sense for the federal government to go it alone on health care reform....
docs.lead_paragraph: In this installment of Health Care Watch, Stuart M. Butler and Ezekiel Emanuel talk about whether it makes sense to first test health care reform at the state level or at the federal level. Go to Mr. Emanuel's post.
docs.abstract: It doesn't make sense for the federal government to go it alone on health care reform.

docs.snippet: Parents influence but they do not command. It is a lesson particularly resonant as elections near and generations find themselves on opposite political sides....
docs.lead_paragraph: Long before I was a parent myself, a friend was telling me about her toddler's love of cats. My friend was a dog person. Her husband was a dog person. They hadn't a clue where this cat lover had come from.
docs.abstract: Parents influence but they do not command. It is a lesson particularly resonant as elections near and generations find themselves on opposite political sides.

docs.snippet: Conservatives are utterly convinced that the mainstream news organizations have been deeply unfair to the Republican ticket, and they have some points they can cite as evidence. For example, the Project for Excellence in Journalism found that ther...
docs.lead_paragraph: Conservatives are utterly convinced that the mainstream news organizations have been deeply unfair to the Republican ticket, and they have some points they can cite as evidence. For example, the Project for Excellence in Journalism found that there were twice as many favorable Obama stories after the convention as favorable McCain ones. Conversely, twice as many McCain stories were negative. The Center for Media and Public Affairs found that network TV coverage of Obama was 65 percent positive, compared to 31 percent positive for McCain. As Politico.com put it: "in the closing weeks of this election, John McCain and Sarah Palin are getting hosed in the press." Indeed, one of the editors of Politico.com received a scolding note about bias from his own mother.
docs.abstract: Conservatives are utterly convinced that the mainstream news organizations have been deeply unfair to the Republican ticket, and they have some points they can cite as evidence. For example, the Project for Excellence in Journalism found that there were twice as many favorable Obama stories after the convention as favorable McCain ones. Conversely, twice as [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Election viewership on television and online could approach records Tuesday night -- provided some suspense holds, the Associated Press reports:
docs.abstract: The presidential campaign has been a TV hit from crowded pre-primary debates through a Barack Obama infomercial last week that reached an ''American Idol''-sized audience. It stands to reason that millions of Americans will tune in for the final results.

docs.snippet: For one African-American columnist, the mere possibility of Obama winning the presidency is mind-boggling....
docs.lead_paragraph: Eugene Robinson uses his column in The Washington Post to reflect on the prospect that, at the end of the day today, a black man will be president of the United States. "Whoever wins this election, I understand what Barack Obama meant when he said his faith in the American people had been 'vindicated' by his campaign's success," Robinson writes. "I understand what Michelle Obama meant, months ago, when she said she was 'proud of my country' for the first time in her adult life. Why should they be immune to the astonishment and vertigo that so many other African Americans are experiencing? Why shouldn't they have to pinch themselves to make sure they aren't dreaming, the way that I do?"
docs.abstract: For one African-American columnist, the mere possibility of Obama winning the presidency is mind-boggling.
